answers.answer: Hi,How are you?The difficulty in talking and pain in the chest could be due to lung nodules. This needs further evaluation.Since you have tingling numbness I would also suggest you to get a blood sugar test done to rule out diabetes.Diabetes can cause peripheral neuropathy which results in tingling numbness.Since your reports are clear, it is possible that your symptoms are due to excessive fatigue and sleep deprivation.Please discuss this possibility with your treating doctor. Keep us posted!

question: Hello,My symptons started with very intermittent lower left abdominal pain.  Over the last year, this has gotten progressively worse & I have several different types of pain (constant ache, sharp long pain, shooting pain, pinprick, etc) in my left lower abdomin most of the time every day.  Also over the last year, my back & chest started having intermittent pain and now I have it all the time.  Feels like everything makes my chest hurt (especially seems like talking makes it hurt).  Now my neck hurts too, not my throat - I dont have sore throat.  Neck has painful ache along with pinpricks of pain at various times.  My left side and lower left back hurt at times too.  I have had many lab tests including 24 hr urinalysis, two abdominal ultrasounds, a colonoscopy, an endoscopy, bone density test, and an abdominal & chest cat scan.  I've also had back & chest X-rays.  All that they have found is low parthyroid hormone.  They also found lung nodules during cat scan so I am scheduled for another.  In addition I was told at one point that I had a ovarian cyst but after my second ultrasound was told there was no abnormalities.  My pain is getting worse, I have strange sensations at times and I really seem to hurt after doing a lot of talking.  I was told that I do not have reflux but I burp up food all the time (I take two prilosec every day).  Also at times I have numbness in left leg & tingling in feet.  I have minimal sinus drainage & dry cough at times.  I have a heavy/tightness in my chest & very minor scratchy feeling in back of my throat.  Help - I feel that I'm getting worse each day.  Where can I go for answers?
title: Undiagnosed Abdominal/Chest Pain
